survey.description:
Il s'agit de l'enquête standard qui devrait être utilisée pour les évaluations des données d'activité afin de se conformer aux lignes directrices proposées par le GIEC pour la représentation cohérente des terres.
Vous pouvez ajouter d'autres questions à l'enquête ou modifier les codes des questions à choix multiples (à l'exception des catégories d'utilisation des terres et des conversions qui ne doivent pas être modifiées. Vous devez adapter les subdivisions d'utilisation des terres à votre situation nationale).
Cette enquête comprend des attributs calculés (qui sont traités par Collect au fur et à mesure que vous remplissez les données du questionnaire) qui vous aident à reconstruire la série temporelle complète d'utilisation des terres de chaque parcelle.
Le résultat de cette enquête est directement exportable vers l'outil d'inventaire des gaz à effet de serre du GIEC.
En savoir plus sur les Lignes directrices du GIEC : https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2006gl/french/pdf/4_Volume4/V4_03_Ch3_Representation.pdf

Este é o levantamento padrão que deve ser usado para avaliações de dados de atividades para cumprir com as diretrizes propostas do IPCC para a Representação Consistente de Terras.
Você pode adicionar mais perguntas à questionário ou modificar os códigos nas perguntas de múltipla escolha (exceto para as categorias de Uso do Solo e conversões que não devem ser alteradas. Você deve adaptar as Subdivisões de Uso do Solo às suas circunstâncias nacionais).
Este questionário inclui atributos calculados (que são processados ​​pelo Collect à medida que você preenche os dados no questionário) que ajudam a reconstruir a Série Temporal de Uso da Terra completa de cada parcela.
O resultado deste questionário pode ser exportado diretamente para o IPCC Green House Gas Inventory Tool.
Mais sobre as Diretrizes do IPCC: https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2006gl/pdf/4_Volume4/V4_03_Ch3_Representation.pdf

Esta es la encuesta estándar que debe usarse para las evaluaciones de datos de actividad para cumplir con las guías propuestas por el IPCC para la Representación Coherente de las Tierras.
Puede agregar más preguntas a la encuesta o modificar los códigos en las preguntas de opción múltiple (a excepción de las categorías y conversiones de Uso de la tierra que no deben cambiarse. Debe adaptar las Subdivisiones de uso de la tierra a sus circunstancias nacionales).
Este cuestionario incluye atributos calculados (que son procesados ​​por Recopilar a medida que completa los datos en el cuestionario) que lo ayudan a reconstruir la serie temporal completa del uso de la tierra de cada parcela.
El resultado de esta encuesta se puede exportar directamente a la herramienta Inventario de gases de efecto invernadero del IPCC.
Ver guía del IPCC : https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2006gl/spanish/pdf/4_Volume4/V4_03_Ch3_Representation.pdf

This is the standard survey that should be used for activity data assessments to comply with the proposed IPCC guidelines for the Consistent Representation of Lands.
You can add more questions to the survey or modify the codes on the multiple choice questions ( except for the Land Use categories and conversions that should not be changed. You should adapt the Land Use Subdivisions to your national circumstances ).
This survey includes calculated attributes (that are processed by Collect as you fill data in the questionnaire) which helps you to reconstruct the full Land Use Timeseries of every plot.
The output of this survey is directly exportable to the IPCC Green House Gas Inventory tool.
More on the IPCC Guidelines : https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2006gl/pdf/4_Volume4/V4_03_Ch3_Representation.pdf

list.name: land_uses
list.label: Utilisation des terres
Land Uses
Usos de la tierra
IPCC Land Use representation Categories/Subdivisions
list.description:
Two-level codelist compliant with the IPCC Consistent Land Representation guidelines.
This codelist represents the Categories and Subdivisions (the conversions are defined in the land_use_conversions codelist ) necessary to classify each of the plots.
The category level is fixed, every survey should use the six IPCC categories without modifying them.
The second level, subdivisions, should be adapted to the specific land-uses of each country.
The categories (Forest/Settlement/Cropland/Grassland/Wetland/Other) are FIXED AND SHOULD NOT BE MODIFIED. DO NOT MODIFY THE CODES EITHER (F/C/G/S/W/O as this is important to calculate the conversion classes). You can modify the labels if they do not fit your language.
DO NOT MODIFY THE CATEGORY/SUBDIVISON structure as this is key for the rest of the survey to be consistent with the IPCC guidelines!!! If you do the calculations of the yearly changes will not work.
SEE: https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2019rf/pdf/4_Volume4/19R_V4_Ch03_Land%20Representation

list.name: land_use_conversions
list.label: IPCC Land Use representation Categories/Conversions
Sub-Categories
list.description:
Two-level codelist compliant with the IPCC Consistent Land Representation guidelines.
This codelist represents the Categories and Conversions (the land uses are defined in the land_uses codelist ) necessary to classify the LU transitions.
Both category and conversion level are fixed, every survey should use the six IPCC categories and 36 conversions classes without modifying them.
For each category there is one remaining (Forest remaining Forest) and five changing conversions (Grassland becoming Forest, Cropland becoming Forest, etc...).
DO NOT MODIFY THE CATEGORY/CONVERIOSN structure as this is key for the rest of the survey to be consistent with the IPCC guidelines!!! If you do, the calculations of the yearly changes will not work.
SEE: https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/public/2019rf/pdf/4_Volume4/19R_V4_Ch03_Land%20Representatio

list.name: plot_coverage
list.label: Control dots
Coverages
Points de contrôle
Puntos de control
Pontos de controle
list.description:
Classes of cover within the plot. The user counts the number of dots that fall within certain land use/land cover/element to classify the plot. For plots with 49 dots (7x7). In case of using other type of plots like 5x5 (25 dots) modify the codelist accordingly.
In the case of 49 dots plots, the user is asked to specify the number of plots if less than 5 fall within a land use/cover. Otherwise the user chooses between ranges. The reasoning for this is to improve the speed of the assessment. If other approach is preferred you should change the codelist accordingly.

Parcela- Fase de avaliação
code.description: Combined with the plot ID generates the Unique Identifier of the plot. The value of this attribute comes from the CSV with the plot grids (sampling design). Use the value 1 "First asessment" for the first time that the plot is assessed. The value 2 "Second assessment" is reserved for the plots that will be revisited and used as a measurement of the operator/interpreter error.

Combinado com o ID da parcela, gera o Identificador Único da parcela. O valor desse atributo vem do CSV com as grades de plotagem (desenho amostral). Use o valor 1 "Primeira avaliação" para a primeira vez que a parcela é avaliada. O valor 2 "Segunda avaliação" é reservado para as parcelas que serão revisitadas e utilizadas como medida de erro do operador/intérprete.

Combiné avec l'ID de parcelle génère l'identifiant unique de la parcelle. La valeur de cet attribut provient du CSV avec les grilles de tracé (plan d'échantillonnage). Utilisez la valeur 1 "Première évaluation" pour la première fois que la parcelle est évaluée. La valeur 2 "Deuxième évaluation" est réservée aux parcelles qui seront revisitées et utilisées comme mesure de l'erreur opérateur/interprète.

Combinado con el ID de parcela genera el Identificador Único de la parcela. El valor de este atributo proviene del CSV con las mallas de las parcelas (diseño de muestreo). Utilizar el valor 1 "Primera evaluación" para la primera vez que se evalúa la parcela. El valor 2 "Segunda evaluación" está reservado para las parcelas que serán revisadas y utilizadas como medida del error del operador/intérprete.

code.name: climate

Climat GIEC
IPCC - Clima
code.description:
Attribute that will allow you to produce disaggregated on Land Use by Climate (Using the IPCC standard climate zones)
The emission factors for certain types of forest or crops will change depending on the type of climate that they are located.
Keep this attribute if you are going to use the data on Green House Gas inventories or FRELs. This attribute is NOT necessary for the Collect Earth survey to work (in case it is not needed in your survey and you do not want to add it to the CSV files)
IPCC Climate Zones 1985-2015 Updated demonstration of the world climate zones described by IPCC in 2019. Download full dataset here : https://www.ipcc-nggip.iges.or.jp/faq/img/IPCC_Climate_Zones_Map_raster.zip
Obtained from the Collect Earth Grid Generator tool. Each plot has this information added as a column in the CSV of the sampling design.

UT minimum = 90%

Si la parcelle est homogène, la couverture doit être > 90 %
Si la parcelle est distinct, la couverture doit être < 90 %

UT maximum = 100%
UT minimum = 90%
